meanings.definition: To place too much emphasis on something.
meanings.sent1: She always overemphases the importance of punctuality.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overemphases his achievements, making others feel inadequate.
meanings.sent3: The teacher overemphases the significance of bringing a pencil to class.
meanings.sent4: His constant overemphases on minor details often leads to delays.
meanings.sent5: The speaker's overemphases on the topic made the audience lose interest.

meanings.definition: The act of placing too much emphasis on something.
meanings.sent1: Her constant overemphases on perfectionism can be exhausting.
meanings.sent2: The overemphases on appearance in the fashion industry can be damaging.
meanings.sent3: The overemphases on the importance of dessert after dinner was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The overemphases on teamwork in the office is like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The overemphases on the benefits of exercise was hard to ignore.
